reviews.review_msg: Terrible prof! Reads directly off the slides and still doesn't seem to know what he's saying. You're better off skipping lectures and reading the slides yourself. Assignments were full of mistakes, and kept changing them last minute. HW was tough, midterm was brutal, and the final? Copy-pasted from the practice exam since the average was so bad. ðŸš©
This professor is so hard PLEASE DO NOT TAKE, IT CAUSED ME SO MUCH OF A HEADACHE
Lectures are literally him reading from a textbook, and he's not even reading it well.

The professor demonstrated a lack of organising ; he frequently announced that assignments would be posted but delayed their release by 2-3 days, and even then, only posted portions of them. The professor dropped the class a month before the final exam and released the last assignment on the final day, leaving no opportunity to appeal for grades.

The professor demonstrated a lack of organization; he frequently announced that assignments would be posted but delayed their release by 2-3 days, and even then, only posted portions of them. For the first assignment, he requested materials only after we had completed the work. Additionally, the teaching assistants were unhelpful.

Work was only given back at the end of semester. Questions about tests/assignments couldn't be answered right away cus he just follows the other prof's outline of the course. Spends too much time on easy topics. Waits for students to answer questions and if no one volunteers he calls on a random person. He seems like a nice guy but not a good prof.

Prof wasn't great. He read off of janice's slides which were a huge mess. Assignments were long and confusing. They also had a lot of mistakes and the grading criteria wasn't always clear plus they weren't marked until the semester was over. the quizzes were also marked really weird bc the TA's ran out of time and basically gave up. final was fair.

Look, I really tried to give him the benefit of the doubt, but here just was simply no way I could ignore all the glaring issues that popped up, whether his fault or not. Honestly, I don't really blame him, some of us first years suck and he had some health issues pop up. He tried, kind of, at the end, I'll give him that. TAs were terrible, though.

Was a new sessional so didn't have any of his own slides or assignments. Basically copied Janice and did whatever she did. Lectures were boring and unengaging since he just read off of Janice's slides. Assignments were always unclear and we only got them back after the semester ended. This class was extremely frustrating but he was nice at least...

Amir is an amazing professor and he teaches every material with passion. He is very kind and always answers students' questions to the best of his ability. He always likes to pay attention to students' comments and match his teaching method to what students find best. Overall, he is very knowledgeable and pays attention to student's concerns.

Amir did his best with Janice's flawed materials, this is his first sem teaching so he will only get better as he develops his own content. What you read about Janice IS true, avoid! But Amir really tried and was understanding, even tho serious health issues meant he was AFK by the end of the course.
Our prof left us alone on finals to go to mexico

Would not recommend at all. Does not reply to emails. Assignments instruction very unclear. Material on assignments not even taught yet. Uploads assignment days after when it was supposed to be uploaded. Reads of slides in class. Grading of assignments very bad. Had a big assignment and a quiz on the week of finals.
We are cooked! Avoid.

Literally everything about this course is flawed. He just keeps reading off the slides in a monotune, torturous voice. Assignment descriptions are like ancient inscriptions written by a bunch of extragalactic aliens. I'd recommend taking it 10/10 if you would like to age 20 years in 4 months and go bald.
Bro can't reply to emails, acknowledge his mistakes or even ***** change the assignment due date after sending the assignment weeks late. Never ******** take this professor.
The worst university experience you can possibly receive. Easily the least competent teacher I will ever encounter during my degree.

This class is outrageous. After posting the input and output files for assignment 2 a week before the deadline, he refused to extend the deadline, we still don't have the functions 4 days before early deadline. We are forced to do this assignment during the weekend and the week of our midterm and a quiz. It is not our fault that it was posted late.

Posts assignment 2 pdf nearly 2 weeks late. Extends due date by 1 week(into week we have midterm and quiz). Many days go by until he finally posts input files(critical), 5 days before the new early due date. Many students ask him to adjust due date to account for his errors. He says no. Still hasn't posted needed functions(4 days before due date).

This class is horrendous. When concerns were raised about the midterm being too long and unreasonable, he responded: "You weren't meant to have any leisure time on the midterm. You were supposed to use all your time. And I did say to look through all the questions before starting." We did just that, but he was adding instructions during the exam.

- he doesn't reply
- you are telling me he is a phd graduate, and doesn't know what live coding means....
- he stutters
- he uses janices slides
- lowkey nice person tho
- just horrible at teaching (very)
- atleast he looks good

This is a coding course... but the teacher doesnt code in class. He simply reads off of slides that he didn't even make. Projects are extremely complicated and slides are riddled with errors. We're half way through the course and about 1/4 of the class actually shows up to lectures. You can take that as you will.

Amir himself is not a bad person but the fact that he must rely on Professor Regan puts a hinderance on this already tough course. Taught us material required for projects after the projects were due in addition to confusing projects. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Swapped major because of this dude

Lectures are not good at all. Slides from different prof AND in C++ when were learning C. Reads of slides and doesnt do a single demenstration. Assignment are extremely unclear and hard. Doesnt help that whats needed to complete them he has never taught.
Lectures are usless. Assignment and midterm are super difficult.

Teaches nothing and gives difficult and unclear assignments. I'm sure the assignments might be moderately bearable if we were given proper resources and actually taught this stuff, but unfortunately not. Would not recommend.

He gives extremely hard assignments that have instructions that are very hard to understand and contains so much ambiguity. They are extremely lengthy as well and is takes 25+ hours to do. He also doesn't answer emails and it is very hard to contact him with doubts. AVOID HIM AT ALL COST.

On top of being an awful professor, Amir is extremely unprofessional. He does not even care to reply to emails even though he has promised to do so on his announcements on canvas. I can't even put up with this anymore. I'm an international student paying 5x for this course. OUTRAGEOUS!

Absolutely Terrible professor. He stutters in class and reads off slides made by Janice Regan. The first midterm was terrible. Majority of the marks (about 63%) were for writing code on paper. There hasn't been a single lecture where he has actually coded in class despite saying that he will. I could write so much more but cc limit. JUST DON"T TAKE

Upping my last rating of 1/5 to 2/5 because the prof has acknowledged our complaints. I feel kind of bad for all the people crapping on him, but his lecturing style was quite unbearable to be honest. He did make his own slides for the last lecture and has promised coding within lectures, so good on him.
HELLO STUDENTS! THIS GUY IS GOOFY! WHAT IS HE TEACHING? IT SURE ISN'T COMP SCI LOL.

Lectures were slides and slides of text that barely made sense, no kind of programming has been taught at all. Tests were grossly disproportionate to what we've actually done, and to make it worse the slides aren't even his. He just copied it off of another professor. Expects us to watch hour-long tutorials on top of lectures. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Sample midterm questions and solutions have errors. In fact, the solutions for the sample midterm weren't even for the correct question. Amir is pulling a 1984 by wiping all the previous reviews. It's an awful class. Midterm was not very relevant to what was taught. The class is 200 people, but now has 50 participants because nothing is taught.
he can't handle criticism, and assignments are filled with errors, sample midterm has the simplest mistakes, and reads off of slides.

I genuinely believe everyone in the class should file a complaint together. it doesn't help that he expects to watch 2 hour long tutorials along with his lectures where he reads off of Janice Regan's slides from 20 years ago.

Lazily reads off slides provided by other professors in the CompSci department, and still hasn't set his office hours halfway through the semester. More than that, he has taken down my review twice now and can't seem to handle criticism. The only professor I have ever filed a formal complaint to SFU for.
the only memory freeing up is the hole in my brain

If the guy wants genuine criticism,
First of all, make an actual lecture. Reading slides word for word for a PROGRAMMIMG class is unacceptable, how there isn't any coding at all is beyond me. 
The entire course is basically you just learning everything on your own. The only time I wish there was a textbook is in this course, there's no direction.
Awful professor
His lectures are ok. He does not communicate at all about the course topics and assignments. He posts material late, and just reads off slides.
He posts everything late and reads off of slides that aren't his
